name: Document Title: ITP-141-RAIL-BRUNT-Track Formation - General Fill
ITP Description: Track Formation - General Fill
ITP approved for use by: Jon De Castro
1.1 - Drawing Pack - Rail Track and Civil
1.2 - Metro Engineering Specifications - Earthworks & Formation Specification
1.3 - Metro Engineering Specifications - Earthworks & Formation Standard
1.4 - Australian Standard - Methods of testing soils for engineering purposes
Reference - L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.10.1. Australian Standard - AS1289
Acceptance Criteria - General Fill shall consist of suitable material that shall be compacted to a minimum characteristic value of density ratio 98%
Frequency - Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - General fill shall comply with the criteria listed in Table 1 (L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.10.4.1.):
○ Dispersion (Emerson class number of soil) - not to be class 1 or 2
○ Collapse strain - to be agreed by MTM geotechnical engineer
Frequency - Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Reference - L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.12.5. Table 7 AS1289 Tests
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall not commence placing any fill on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Responsible Engineer.
Frequency - Prior to commencement of fill works
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative signoff
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Set out pegs in place and clearly mark out limits of works.
Frequency - Prior to commencement of fill works
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
5.1 - General Fill Preparation and Installation - For track constructed on embankment (1 of 2)
Reference - L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.10.3.1. Australian Standard - AS1289 IFC Drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Any surface on which fills are to be constructed shall be proof rolled.
○ All layers of general fill material shall be compacted to a minimum characteristic value of density ratio of 98% (Standard Compaction)
○ Where a layers to be constructed in fill it shall be constructed in uniform thickness not exceeding 200mm lose.
– Volume < 1000m³ atleast one set of tests shall be carried out
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
5.2 - General Fill Preparation and Installation - For track constructed on embankment (2 of 2)
Reference - L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.10.3.1. Australian Standard - AS1289 IFC Drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - General fill shall comply with the criteria listed in Table 1 (L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.10.4.1.):
○ Dispersion (Emerson class number of soil) - not to be class 1 or 2
○ Collapse strain - to be agreed by MTM geotechnical engineer
○ Volume < 1000m³ atleast one set of tests shall be carried out
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Proof roll as per L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.10.3.1.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative Signoff
6.1 - General Fill Finishing and Tolerances - For track constructed on embankment / Survey Conformance
Acceptance Criteria - General fill on embankments shall be installed within +/- 40mm of approved design surface level
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
